New Records: Rohit Sharma scored his 5th T20 century, becoming the only batter with 5 centuries in T20 cricket.
Rohit Sharma's 121* is his highest individual score in T20 cricket.
Key Match Events: Rohit Sharma scored an unbeaten 121 off 69 balls.
Fareed Ahmad Malik took 3 wickets for 20 runs.
India equalled Afghanistan's score of 16 in the first super over.
Ravi Bishnoi took 2 wickets in the second super over to secure the win for India.
India won the match after two thrilling super overs.
Pre-Game Insights: India aimed to sweep the three-match T20 series against Afghanistan.
The match was held at M Chinnaswamy Stadium in Bangalore.
The pitch at M Chinnaswamy Stadium is known to favor batters.
The weather conditions were supportive with no rain prediction and a temperature of around 20.8 degrees Celsius.
Post-Match Reflections: Rohit Sharma expressed pride in the team's performance after scoring his 5th T20 century.
Afghanistan aimed to salvage some pride in the final encounter but fell short.
Miscellaneous Highlights: India won the toss and chose to bat first.
The match was broadcast on the Sports 18 network and live-streamed on JioCinema.
India made three changes to their playing XI, bringing in Sanju Samson, Avesh Khan, and Kuldeep Yadav.
